Title: Cyberattackers Exploit Common Windows Tool to Sneak Malicious Software Into Systems

In recent weeks, cybersecurity experts have uncovered a troubling tactic used by hackers to hide harmful programs within everyday computer operations. The crooks are taking advantage of a seemingly harmless tool that is built into Windows, the popular software used across many companies and homes worldwide.

This is when cyber intruders try to understand the layout of a company's computing environment, including the virtual servers, software containers, and various system components.

According to insiders, the suspicious activities included remote queries to their container management systems and accessing their administrative dashboards. Without proper safeguards, these actions allowed the intruder to gather details about how NovaSoft's software was structured, including what applications were running, where the virtual servers were located, and which cloud services they relied on.
